title: Authors and Citation
text: Stef van Buuren. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: van Buuren S (2022). jamesclient: Client-side R Functions JAMES. R package version 0.28.2, https://github.com/growthcharts/jamesclient.
code: @Manual{,   title = {jamesclient: Client-side R Functions for JAMES},   author = {Stef {van Buuren}},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.28.2},   url = {https://github.com/growthcharts/jamesclient}, }

title: Client-side R Functions for JAMES
text: goal jamesclient facilitate interaction R users Joint Automatic Measurement Evaluation System (JAMES). JAMES online resource creating growth charts analysing growth curves.

title: Client-side R Functions for JAMES
text: can install development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("growthcharts/jamesclient")

title: Client-side R Functions for JAMES
text: primary functions :

title: Client-side R Functions for JAMES
text: Upload BDS data
code: library(jamesclient) fn <- system.file("extdata", "allegrosultum", "client3.json",                    package = "jamesdemodata", mustWork = TRUE) host <- "https://james.groeidiagrammen.nl" r1 <- james_post(host = host, path = "data/upload/json", txt = fn) r1$parsed #> $psn #>   id                                 name        dob       dobf       dobm  src #> 1 -1 fa308134-069e-49ce-9847-ccdae380ed6f 2018-10-11 1995-07-04 1990-12-02 1234 #>      sex gad ga smo  bw hgtm hgtf agem etn #> 1 female 189 27   1 990  167  190   27  NL #>  #> $xyz #>       age xname yname zname                  zref       x     y      z #> 1  0.0849   age   hgt hgt_z nl_2012_hgt_female_27  0.0849 38.00 -0.158 #> 2  0.1670   age   hgt hgt_z nl_2012_hgt_female_27  0.1670 43.50  0.047 #> 3  0.0849   age   wgt wgt_z nl_2012_wgt_female_27  0.0849  1.25 -0.203 #> 4  0.1670   age   wgt wgt_z nl_2012_wgt_female_27  0.1670  2.10  0.015 #> 5  0.0849   age   hdc hdc_z nl_2012_hdc_female_27  0.0849 27.00 -0.709 #> 6  0.1670   age   hdc hdc_z nl_2012_hdc_female_27  0.1670 30.50 -0.913 #> 7  0.0849   age   bmi bmi_z nl_1997_bmi_female_nl  0.0849  8.66 -5.719 #> 8  0.1670   age   bmi bmi_z nl_1997_bmi_female_nl  0.1670 11.10 -3.767 #> 9  0.0849   hgt   wfh wfh_z   nl_2012_wfh_female_ 38.0000  1.25 -0.001 #> 10 0.1670   hgt   wfh wfh_z   nl_2012_wfh_female_ 43.5000  2.10  0.326 #> 11 0.0000   age   wgt wgt_z nl_2012_wgt_female_27  0.0000  0.99  0.190

title: Client-side R Functions for JAMES
text: Get output R console (just checking) end points, see https://james.groeidiagrammen.nl.
code: r2 <- james_get(host = host, path = paste(r1$session, "console", sep = "/")) cat(r2$parsed, "\n") #> > upload_data(txt = c("{\"Referentie\":\"fa308134-069e-49ce-9847-ccdae380ed6f\",\"OrganisatieCode\":1234,\"ClientGegevens\":{\"Elementen\":[{\"Bdsnummer\":19,\"Waarde\":\"2\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":20,\"Waarde\":\"20181011\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":82,\"Waarde\":\"189\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":91,\"Waarde\":\"1\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":110,\"Waarde\":\"990\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":238,\"Waarde\":\"1670\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":240,\"Waarde\":\"1900\"}],\"Groepen\":[{\"Elementen\":[{\"Bdsnummer\":63,\"Waarde\":\"19950704\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":71,\"Waarde\":\"6030\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":62,\"Waarde\":\"01\"}]},{\"Elementen\":[{\"Bdsnummer\":63,\"Waarde\":\"19901202\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":71,\"Waarde\":\"6030\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":62,\"Waarde\":\"02\"}]}]},\"Contactmomenten\":[{\"Tijdstip\":\"20181111\",\"Elementen\":[{\"Bdsnummer\":235,\"Waarde\":\"380\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":245,\"Waarde\":\"1250\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":252,\"Waarde\":\"270\"}]},{\"Tijdstip\":\"20181211\",\"Elementen\":[{\"Bdsnummer\":235,\"Waarde\":\"435\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":245,\"Waarde\":\"2100\"},{\"Bdsnummer\":252,\"Waarde\":\"305\"}]}]}")) #> List of length  2  #> [psn] #> [xyz]

title: Client-side R Functions for JAMES
text: Everything can done james_post() james_get(). functions needed anymore, deprecated future.

title: Client-side R Functions for JAMES
text: Upload BDS data create tibble server:
code: library(jamesclient) fn <- file.path(path.package("jamesclient"), "testdata", "client3.json") r1 <- upload_txt(fn) browseURL(get_url(r1, "return"))

title: Client-side R Functions for JAMES
text: Make combined upload automatic chartcode choice:
code: r2 <- request_chart(fn, chartcode = "PJAHN27") browseURL(get_url(r2, "svg"))

what: Download results from ocpu server as a list — download_as_list
title: Download results from ocpu server as a list — download_as_list
text: Obtains thecontents one url's OpenCPU server response list.

title: Download results from ocpu server as a list — download_as_list
code: download_as_list(resp, pattern = "R/.val")

title: Download results from ocpu server as a list — download_as_list
text: resp object class httr::response(), typically returned previous call httr::POST server. pattern character vector trailing part requested url, e.g. "R/.val" "stdout". Use "" obtain results.

title: Download results from ocpu server as a list — download_as_list
text: list contents url's match pattern. result length 0 pattern found.

title: Download results from ocpu server as a list — download_as_list
code: if (FALSE) { file <- file.path(path.package("jamesclient"), "testdata", "client3.json") resp <- upload_txt(file) resp download_as_list(resp, pattern = "stdout") }

what: Get url from OpenCPU response — get_url
title: Get url from OpenCPU response — get_url
text: Get url OpenCPU response

title: Get url from OpenCPU response — get_url
code: get_url(   resp,   name = c("return", "location", "session", "console", "stdout", "svg", "svglite",     "messages", "warnings", "json", "rda"),   ... )  get_url_svg(resp, pad = "?width=7&height=7", ...)

title: Get url from OpenCPU response — get_url
text: resp object class httr::response() returned OpenCPU. name string: "return", "location", "session", "console", "stdout", "svg", "svglite", "messages", "warnings", "json", "rda". default "return". ... Additional string concatenate URL pad string padded url.

title: Get url from OpenCPU response — get_url
text: url. found, return character(0).

title: Get url from OpenCPU response — get_url
text: get_url() exported, use get_url() code.

what: Inspect demo data uploaded to JAMES — inspect_demodata
title: Inspect demo data uploaded to JAMES — inspect_demodata
text: Uploads JSON child demo data localhost downloads processed data inspection.

title: Inspect demo data uploaded to JAMES — inspect_demodata
code: inspect_demodata(   name,   cabinet,   format = c("2.0", "1.0", "1.1"),   host = "http://localhost",   mod = character(0) )

title: Inspect demo data uploaded to JAMES — inspect_demodata
text: name Name child cabinet Name cabinet format String. JSON data schema version number. currently three schemas supported: "1.0", "1.1" "2.0". Formats "1.0" "1.1" included backward compatibility . Use format = "2.0" new applications. host String host. default "http://localhost". mod String module path, . default "".

title: Inspect demo data uploaded to JAMES — inspect_demodata
code: if (FALSE) { data <- inspect_demodata(name = "Anne_S", cabinet = "smocc") head(data) }

title: Make JAMES GET request — james_get
text: Make JAMES GET request

title: Make JAMES GET request — james_get
code: james_get(   host = "http://localhost",   mod = character(0),   path = character(0),   ... )

title: Make JAMES GET request — james_get
text: host String host. default "http://localhost". mod String module path, . default "". path String path called end point, e.g. "version", "data/upload" "data/upload/json". ... Extra arguments create URI GET()

title: Make JAMES GET request — james_get
text: Object class james_get

title: Make JAMES POST request — james_post
text: Make JAMES POST request

title: Make JAMES POST request — james_post
code: james_post(   host = "http://localhost",   mod = character(0),   path = character(0),   query = list(),   txt = NULL,   ... )

title: Make JAMES POST request — james_post
text: host String host. default "http://localhost". mod String module path, . default "". path String path called end point, e.g. "version", "data/upload" "data/upload/json". query list query arguments, example, list(auto_unbox = TRUE) json output, list(width = 7.09, height = 7.09) svglite. txt Data set. URL, local file, JSON string JSON object. ... arguments passed james functions via POST body

title: Make JAMES POST request — james_post
text: Object class c("james_httr", "response"). object extends httr::response object components: messages (messages generated JAMES), warnings (warnings generated JAMES), parsed (parsed return value called end point), session(session key).

title: Make JAMES POST request — james_post
code: if (FALSE) { url <- paste("http://localhost", "ocpu/library/jamesdemodata",   "extdata/bds_v1.0/smocc/Laura_S.json", sep = "/") fn <- system.file("extdata", "bds_v2.0", "smocc", "Laura_S.json",  package = "jamesdemodata", mustWork = TRUE) fn <- system.file("extdata", "allegrosultum", "client3.json",  package = "jamesdemodata", mustWork = TRUE) js <- read_json_js(txt = fn) jo <- read_json_jo(txt = fn)  #' try all inputs m1 <- james_post(path = "data/upload/json", txt = fn) m2 <- james_post(path = "data/upload/json", txt = js) m3 <- james_post(path = "data/upload/json", txt = url) m4 <- james_post(path = "data/upload/json", txt = jo) } if (FALSE) { # create, store and view an A4 SVG plot r5 <- james_post(path = "/charts/draw/svglite", txt = url, chartcode = "NMBA", selector = "chartcode", query = list(height = 29.7/2.54, width = 21/2.54)) tmp <- tempfile(pattern = "chart", fileext = ".svg") writeLines(r5$parsed, con = tmp) browseURL(tmp) unlink(tmp) }

what: Read JSON content from file or URL — read_json_js
title: Read JSON content from file or URL — read_json_js
text: read_json_js() read_json_jo() read JSON file URL. Function read_json_js() returns string, read_json_jo() returns object class jsonlite::class-json.

title: Read JSON content from file or URL — read_json_js
code: read_json_js(txt = NULL)  read_json_jo(txt = NULL)

title: Read JSON content from file or URL — read_json_js
text: txt file name URL

title: Read JSON content from file or URL — read_json_js
code: if (FALSE) { url <- paste("http://localhost", "ocpu/library/jamesdemodata",   "extdata/bds_v2.0/smocc/Laura_S.json", sep = "/") fn <- system.file("extdata", "bds_v2.0", "smocc", "Laura_S.json",  package = "jamesdemodata", mustWork = TRUE) fn <- system.file("extdata", "allegrosultum", "client3.json",  package = "jamesdemodata", mustWork = TRUE) js1 <- read_json_js(url) js2 <- read_json_js(fn) jo1 <- read_json_jo(url) jo2 <- read_json_jo(fn) }

what: Request a growth chart from JAMES — request_chart
title: Request a growth chart from JAMES — request_chart
text: function requests growth chart groeidiagrammen.nl. function can upload JSON file BDS-format server, parse contents tibble person attribute, draw plot. user may skip uploading, use previously stored location server.

title: Request a growth chart from JAMES — request_chart
code: request_chart(   txt = NULL,   loc = NULL,   host = "https://groeidiagrammen.nl",   chartcode = NULL,   selector = NULL,   curve_interpolation = TRUE )

title: Request a growth chart from JAMES — request_chart
text: txt JSON string, URL file data JSON format. input data adhere specification BDS JGZ 3.2.5, converted JSON according schema. loc Alternative txt. Location input data uploaded converted internal server format. host host upload chartcode code requested growth chart. specified, server automatically plot child height recent age period. selector Either "chartcode", "data" "derive". See james::draw_chart() docs detail. curve_interpolation Logical. Smooth growth curve along centiles?

title: Request a growth chart from JAMES — request_chart
text: object class httr::response()

title: Request a growth chart from JAMES — request_chart
text: One txt resp need specified. given, non-NULL txt takes precedence resp.

title: Request a growth chart from JAMES — request_chart
code: if (FALSE) { # examples with direct uploads url <- "https://groeidiagrammen.nl/ocpu/library/james/testdata/client3.json" fn <- system.file("testdata", "client3.json", package = "jamesclient") host <- "http://localhost"  js1 <- readLines(fn) js2 <- jsonlite::toJSON(jsonlite::fromJSON(fn), auto_unbox = TRUE)  # request default chart (PMAHN27) resp1 <- request_chart(url, host = host) # browseURL(get_url(resp1, "svglite"))  # request 30 weeks chart ((PMAHN30) resp2 <- request_chart(url, host = host, chartcode = "PMAHN30") resp3 <- request_chart(fn, host = host, chartcode = "PMAHN30") resp4 <- request_chart(js1, host = host, chartcode = "PMAHN30") resp5 <- request_chart(js2, host = host, chartcode = "PMAHN30")  # in two steps: first upload then request chart resp6 <- upload_txt(fn, host = host) loc <- get_url(resp6, "loc") resp7 <- request_chart(loc = loc, host = host, chartcode = "PMAHN30") }

what: Upload and parse data for JAMES — upload_txt
title: Upload and parse data for JAMES — upload_txt
text: Client side upload JSON file, string URL BDS data, checks data, stores contents tibble person attribute host, returns object class httr::response() contains results request.

title: Upload and parse data for JAMES — upload_txt
code: upload_txt(   txt,   host = "http://localhost",   mod = character(0),   format = "2.0",   schema = NULL,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Upload and parse data for JAMES — upload_txt
text: txt Data set. URL, local file, JSON string JSON object. host String host. default "http://localhost". mod String module path, . default "". format String. JSON data schema version number. currently three schemas supported: "1.0", "1.1" "2.0". Formats "1.0" "1.1" included backward compatibility . Use format = "2.0" new applications. schema file name (optionally including path) JSON validation schema. schema argument overrides format. function extracts version number basename, overwrites format argument version number. verbose Logical. Print diagnostic information POST request console.

title: Upload and parse data for JAMES — upload_txt
text: object class httr::response()

title: Upload and parse data for JAMES — upload_txt
text: JSON format: See https://stefvanbuuren.name/jamesdocs/getting-data--james.html specification JSON format. User agent: function upload_txt() searches object called ua search list. ua object optional user agent, request identifies API. example, run httr::user_agent("https://github.com/myaccount") (myaccount replaced github user name) calling upload_txt(). See https://httr.r-lib.org/articles/api-packages.html details. Setting user agent required. Append "/json" path set query = "auto_unbox=TRUE&force=TRUE" obtain partial JSON representation S4 class individual. present, possible rebuild S4 class individual JSON representation S4 class depends environments, converted JSON. Warning: S4 class individual internal format development. likely change, build applications based data structure. need components internal structure (e.g. Z-scores, brokenstick estimates) better develop dedicated API obtaining .

title: Upload and parse data for JAMES — upload_txt
code: if (FALSE) { library(httr)  host <- "http://localhost" url <- paste(host, "ocpu/library/jamesdemodata",   "extdata/bds_v2.0/smocc/Laura_S.json", sep = "/") fn <- system.file("extdata", "bds_v2.0", "smocc", "Laura_S.json",  package = "jamesdemodata", mustWork = TRUE) js1 <- readLines(url) js2 <- jsonlite::toJSON(jsonlite::fromJSON(url), auto_unbox = TRUE)  # upload JSON file r1 <- upload_txt(fn, host) identical(status_code(r1), 201L)  # upload JSON string r2a <- upload_txt(js1, host) identical(status_code(r2a), 201L) r2b <- upload_txt(js2, host) identical(status_code(r2b), 201L)  # upload JSON from external URL. r3 <- upload_txt(url, host, format = "1.0") identical(status_code(r3), 201L) # browseURL(get_url(r3))  r <- GET(paste(get_url(r3), "json", sep = "/")) r }

title: jamesclient 0.28.2
text: Add _pkgdown.yaml automate site building

title: jamesclient 0.28.1
text: Disables testing (services may offline) Refreshes github actions scripts

title: jamesclient 0.28.0
text: Simplifies james_get() Updates README Removes dependency bdsreader package

title: jamesclient 0.27.0
text: Adds mod parameters handle “hosts” module path. contents mod prepended path.

title: jamesclient 0.26.1
text: Prevents redirects messages warnings james_get() james_post()

title: jamesclient 0.26.0
text: Redefines response values james_get() james_post conform httr response object Redefines james_post() return response case request error

title: jamesclient 0.26.0
text: get_url() now works without location header Adds new tests james_post() Makes now one reference x-ocpu-session header

title: jamesclient 0.25.0
text: Sets https://james.groeidiagrammen.nl default host upload_txt()

title: jamesclient 0.24.0
text: Adds support SVG file james_post()

title: jamesclient 0.23.0
text: Add read_json_js() read_json_jo() read JSON data Solve bug james_get() gave wrong URL modifications Solve bug james_post() gave “process ‘txt’” text = NULL

title: jamesclient 0.22.1
text: Simplify james_post() string read Change url.exists() .url()

title: jamesclient 0.22.0
text: Adds dots argument james_post() james_get()

title: jamesclient 0.21.0
text: Adds host argument james_post() james_get()
